course_description: Epigenetics is the study of heritable characteristics not caused by changes in DNA sequence, but rather induced by non-genetic factors that alter gene expression and are dependent on time and location. The course explores epigenetics and its relation to normal development and disease.
prerequisites: [(BIOL 142 or BIOL_OX 142) and BIOL 264] or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2670, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: A. Eisen, Status: Open
